segment.source: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Publish and Unpublish an Application on the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: Even though an application is installed in a MED-V workspace, you might also have to publish the application before it becomes available to the end user.
segment.target: Even though an application is installed in a MED-V workspace, you might also have to publish the application before it becomes available to the end user.

segment.source: By default, most applications are published at the time that they are installed and shortcuts are created and enabled.
segment.target: By default, most applications are published at the time that they are installed and shortcuts are created and enabled.

segment.source: In some cases, you might want to install applications on the MED-V workspace without making them available to the end user, for example, virus-scanning software.
segment.target: In some cases, you might want to install applications on the MED-V workspace without making them available to the end user, for example, virus-scanning software.

segment.source: Similarly, there are occasions in which you want to publish an application that is installed on the MED-V workspace that was previously unavailable to the end user.
segment.target: Similarly, there are occasions in which you want to publish an application that is installed on the MED-V workspace that was previously unavailable to the end user.

segment.source: For example, you might have to publish an installed application if the installation did not automatically create a shortcut on the Start menu.
segment.target: For example, you might have to publish an installed application if the installation did not automatically create a shortcut on the Start menu.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you publish an application that does not support UNC paths, we recommend that you map the application to a drive.
segment.target: If you publish an application that does not support UNC paths, we recommend that you map the application to a drive.

segment.source: You can publish or unpublish applications to a deployed MED-V workspace by performing one of the following tasks:
segment.target: You can publish or unpublish applications to a deployed MED-V workspace by performing one of the following tasks:

segment.source: To publish or unpublish an installed application
segment.target: To publish or unpublish an installed application

segment.source: To publish an application on a deployed MED-V workspace, copy a shortcut for that application to the following folder on the virtual machine:
segment.target: To publish an application on a deployed MED-V workspace, copy a shortcut for that application to the following folder on the virtual machine:

segment.source: C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersStart Menu
segment.target: C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersStart Menu

segment.source: If it is necessary, use Group Policy or an ESD system to deploy a script that copies the shortcut for that application to the All UsersStart Menu folder.
segment.target: If it is necessary, use Group Policy or an ESD system to deploy a script that copies the shortcut for that application to the All UsersStart Menu folder.

segment.source: To unpublish an application on a deployed MED-V workspace, delete the shortcut for that application from the following folder on the virtual machine:
segment.target: To unpublish an application on a deployed MED-V workspace, delete the shortcut for that application from the following folder on the virtual machine:

segment.source: C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersStart Menu
segment.target: C:Documents and SettingsAll UsersStart Menu

segment.source: If it is necessary, use Group Policy or an ESD system to deploy a script that deletes the shortcut for that application from the All UsersStart Menu folder.
segment.target: If it is necessary, use Group Policy or an ESD system to deploy a script that deletes the shortcut for that application from the All UsersStart Menu folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Frequently, the shortcut is automatically deleted from the host computer Start menu when you uninstall the application.
segment.target: Frequently, the shortcut is automatically deleted from the host computer Start menu when you uninstall the application.

segment.source: However, in some cases, such as for a MED-V workspace that is configured for all users of a shared computer, you might have to manually delete the shortcut on the Start menu after the application is uninstalled.
segment.target: However, in some cases, such as for a MED-V workspace that is configured for all users of a shared computer, you might have to manually delete the shortcut on the Start menu after the application is uninstalled.

segment.source: The end-user can do this by right-clicking the shortcut and selecting Delete.
segment.target: The end-user can do this by right-clicking the shortcut and selecting Delete.

segment.source: To test that the application was published or unpublished, verify on the MED-V workspace whether the corresponding shortcut is available or not.
segment.target: To test that the application was published or unpublished, verify on the MED-V workspace whether the corresponding shortcut is available or not.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Applications that are included in Windows XP SP3 and are located in the virtual machine Start Menu folder are not automatically published to the host.
segment.target: Applications that are included in Windows XP SP3 and are located in the virtual machine Start Menu folder are not automatically published to the host.

segment.source: They are controlled by registry settings that block automatic publishing.
segment.target: They are controlled by registry settings that block automatic publishing.

segment.source: For more information, see Windows Virtual PC Application Exclude List.
segment.target: For more information, see Windows Virtual PC Application Exclude List.

segment.source: To publish Control Panel items
segment.target: To publish Control Panel items

segment.source: Create a shortcut on the virtual machine where the target is the name of the item, such as C:WINDOWSsystem32appwiz.cpl.
segment.target: Create a shortcut on the virtual machine where the target is the name of the item, such as C:WINDOWSsystem32appwiz.cpl.

segment.source: The shortcut must be either created in or moved to the "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%Start Menu" folder or one of its subfolders.
segment.target: The shortcut must be either created in or moved to the "%ALLUSERSPROFILE%Start Menu" folder or one of its subfolders.

segment.source: The item will be published to the host computer in the corresponding location in the host Start Menu folder.
segment.target: The item will be published to the host computer in the corresponding location in the host Start Menu folder.

segment.source: Start the shortcut for the item in the host.
segment.target: Start the shortcut for the item in the host.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: When you create the shortcut, do not specify %SystemRoot%control.exe.
segment.target: When you create the shortcut, do not specify %SystemRoot%control.exe.

segment.source: This application will not be published because it is contained in the registry settings that block automatic publishing.
segment.target: This application will not be published because it is contained in the registry settings that block automatic publishing.

segment.source: How MED-V handles automatic application publishing
segment.target: How MED-V handles automatic application publishing

segment.source: During application publishing, MED-V copies the shortcuts from the guest virtual machine to the host computer by trying to match the folder hierarchy that exists in the guest.
segment.target: During application publishing, MED-V copies the shortcuts from the guest virtual machine to the host computer by trying to match the folder hierarchy that exists in the guest.

segment.source: By doing this, MED-V copies shortcuts from the guest to the host by following these steps:
segment.target: By doing this, MED-V copies shortcuts from the guest to the host by following these steps:

segment.source: MED-V tries to locate a folder under Start MenuPrograms in the host computer that is named the same as the folder in the guest where the shortcut resides.
segment.target: MED-V tries to locate a folder under Start MenuPrograms in the host computer that is named the same as the folder in the guest where the shortcut resides.

segment.source: If there is no matching folder, MED-V then tries to locate a folder in the host Start Menu folder that is named the same as the folder in the guest where the shortcut resides.
segment.target: If there is no matching folder, MED-V then tries to locate a folder in the host Start Menu folder that is named the same as the folder in the guest where the shortcut resides.

segment.source: If there is no matching folder, MED-V copies the shortcut to the default folder on the host, the Start MenuPrograms folder.
segment.target: If there is no matching folder, MED-V copies the shortcut to the default folder on the host, the Start MenuPrograms folder.

segment.source: Example of application publishing process:
segment.target: Example of application publishing process:

segment.source: If an application shortcut is published to the Start MenuProgramsAppShortcuts folder in the guest, then MED-V looks in the host computer for a Start MenuPrograms AppShortcuts folder and if found, copies the shortcut to that folder.
segment.target: If an application shortcut is published to the Start MenuProgramsAppShortcuts folder in the guest, then MED-V looks in the host computer for a Start MenuPrograms AppShortcuts folder and if found, copies the shortcut to that folder.

segment.source: If the folder is not found, then MED-V looks in the host computer for a Start MenuAppShortcuts folder and if found, copies the shortcut to that folder.
segment.target: If the folder is not found, then MED-V looks in the host computer for a Start MenuAppShortcuts folder and if found, copies the shortcut to that folder.

segment.source: If the folder is not found, then MED-V copies the shortcut to the Start MenuPrograms folder.
segment.target: If the folder is not found, then MED-V copies the shortcut to the Start MenuPrograms folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A folder must already exist in the host computer Start Menu folder for MED-V to copy the shortcut there.
segment.target: A folder must already exist in the host computer Start Menu folder for MED-V to copy the shortcut there.

segment.source: MED-V does not create the folder if it does not already exist.
segment.target: MED-V does not create the folder if it does not already exist.
